data.description: As the global leader in high-speed connectivity, Ciena is committed to a people-first approach. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a flexible work environment that empowers individual growth, well-being, and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact. Ciena is on the lookout for an enthusiastic JIRA Automation Intern with a keen interest in AI/GAI processes to join our innovative team. This role is designed for individuals who, though may not have extensive experience in system administration, possess a foundational understanding of JIRA and its automation capabilities, coupled with an interest in AI/GAI. The selected candidate will support our projects by leveraging JIRA automation to streamline operations and by contributing insights on AI/GAI processes. Key Responsibilities: · Assist in the utilization of JIRA's automation features to enhance project workflows and efficiency. Support the team in managing JIRA configurations, focusing on automation rules without administering the system directly. · Collaborate with team members to gather requirements for automating repetitive tasks within JIRA. · Participate in the exploration and application of AI/GAI concepts to support project objectives. · Help in documenting JIRA processes and automation workflows for internal use. · Engage with internal teams to gather feedback on the JIRA automation features and suggest improvements. · Assist in training initiatives by preparing materials that highlight the use of JIRA automation tools. · Stay informed about the latest trends in JIRA automation and AI/GAI technologies to contribute to team discussions. Skills and Qualifications: · Current enrollment in or recent graduation from a Bachelor’s program in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, with a keen interest in JIRA and AI/GAI. · Basic understanding of JIRA, particularly its automation features. · A strong desire to learn about AI/GAI processes and their application in a business context. · Excellent problem-solving skills and a detail-oriented mindset. · Effective communication skills, capable of conveying ideas to both technical and non-technical team members. · Proactive in reaching out to colleagues and customers to gather information or provide assistance. · An organized approach to tasks and the ability to manage multiple priorities. · A team player mindset with the ability to also work independently when required. · Understanding of scripting (Bash, etc..) , APIs (JIRA) · Demonstrated coding skills in different languages (Python, Javascript, etc...) At Ciena, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment. We consider all applicants based on merit, qualifications, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. This internship offers a valuable opportunity to gain hands-on experience in JIRA automation and to explore AI/GAI processes within a global leader in networking systems. If you are passionate about technology and eager to learn in a supportive environment, we encourage you to apply Pay ranges at Ciena are designed to accommodate variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions, and locations, reflecting our diverse products, industries, and lines of business. Please note that the pay range information provided in this posting pertains specifically to the primary location, which is the top location listed in case multiple locations are available. In addition to competitive compensation, Ciena offers students access to the Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company-paid holidays, paid sick leave, and vacation pay as required by applicable laws.
